results.title: Space probes: exploring our solar system
results.brief_description: Tells the story of efforts to explore the outer regions of space from the launching of Pioneer 1 in 1958 to the program in 1964 for gaining more information about the moon, the sun, and the solar system. Examines the problems involved in collecting and relaying the information from space probes and explains how such problems are being, or will be, solved in preparation for manned space expeditions.
results.description: Tells the story of efforts to explore the outer regions of space from the launching of Pioneer 1 in 1958 to the program in 1964 for gaining more information about the moon, the sun, and the solar system. results.title: Space invaders: sexual harrasment at work
results.brief_description: Space Invaders is a series of 7 trigger films designed to encourage the discussion of sexual harassment in the workplace; to raise awareness of the issue within organisations, to assist women to recognise sexual harassment for what it is, and to develop ways of dealing with it.
results.description: Space Invaders is a series of 7 trigger films designed to encourage the discussion of sexual harassment in the workplace; to raise awareness of the issue within organisations, to assist women to recognise sexual harassment for what it is, and to develop ways of dealing with it.

results.title: Space in the seventies: exploration of the planets
results.creator_credit: Colin Cantwell, Lester Novros, Graphic Films and National Aeronautics and Space Administration
results.brief_description: This film very briefly covers the early notions we had about space, and then progresses to actual data collected from space flights to the Moon, Mars and Saturn. Information and findings are presented by artists’ impressions, animation, and computer printouts. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Space ballet: a story of Apollo 9
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency and United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: The flight of Apollo 9 to splashdown on March 13, 1969, showing the flight of the Lunar Module, the first in space history. Emphasis is placed on the human aspects of the flight. Music is from the feature film, “Yellow Submarine”. Narrated by Pernell Roberts.

results.title: SPAA Conference 2002
results.brief_description: The Screen Producers Conference is the key national industry conference and is to be held in Melbourne 2001, 2002 and 2003. The conference delegates represent the major broadcast networks, production houses and independent producers in Australia. The Conference is a three day event and usually coincides with the annual Australian Film Institute (AFI)Awards.

results.title: Sown pastures
results.brief_description: A record of an experiment carried out at the CSIRO Research Station, Armidale, N.S.W., which shows the improvement in health and wool returns of sheep grazing sown pastures compared with those grazing natural pasture. Coloured graphs are used to show more clearly the differences between these two groups of sheep.

results.title: Soviet Union: faces of today

results.title: Sovereign Hill: goldmining township, Ballarat
results.brief_description: A look at Sovereign Hill- a reconstructed goldmining town in Ballarat. Shows not only the buildings and the implements but also shows how the people lived.

results.title: Souvenirs from Sweden
results.creator_credit: Henning Carlsen, Svensk Filmindustri and Svenska filminstitutet
results.brief_description: An unconventional picture of modern Sweden, its people and its natural beauty. Sailing in the archipelago, glass-blowing at Orrefors, the Vasa skiing race, the Nobel Festival - the everyday life of Swedes and their special occasions. (Awards: Grand Prize of the Annual International Travel Film Festival)
